author: Alexandra Wexler
title: The Most Relaxing Diving Holiday in the Least Likely Destination
text:
FOR MOST PEOPLE planning a scuba-diving holiday, a landlocked body of water in southern Africa would be the last destination on their list. But when my fiancé, Jonathan, and I re-emerged after our first dive in the translucent 82-degree waters of Lake Malawi, and bobbed on the pancake-flat surface, we were converted. 

Descending some 2,300 feet, Lake Malawi is one of the world’s deepest lakes and among the largest by area. It makes up about 20% of the total footprint of the tiny, impoverished southern African nation of Malawi,...
